result.execSummary:
The defendant Kristopher Charles Bonikowske was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Kristopher Charles Bonikowske is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Kristopher Charles Bonikowske was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "B"], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury

supervisions.notes:
Payment plan approved of $25.00 per month commencing February 1, 2016.
Apply bond on file.
Defendant to provide a DNA sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kristopher Charles Bonikowske

defendant.name: Bonikowske, Kristopher Charles
defendant.address: 364 Old Cemetery Road, River Falls, WI 54022

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Order for payment at 02-01-2016 01:30 pm
DE mailed copy this date. jaf
Per Judge's order.  DE to pay $25/mo comm 2-01-16.  $15 Pplan Fee added.  DE will be mailed an Order for Pymt. jaf

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Matthew L Hartung DF ATTY: John A. Kucinski DF: Kristopher Charles Bonikowske appeared. Case called at 9:19. Atty. Kucinski updates the court there is a resolution.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads NC to Ct 2 in 15CM387. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 2 in 15CM387. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct 1 in 15CM387 and dismisses the domestic violence enhancer of Ct. 2. Sentencing arguments. DE makes statement. Crt orders:
- Court notes 1 day credit.
- Costs 
- Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge.

Court sets payment plan of $25 a month to begin Feb. 1, 2016
Apply bond on file.

Apprs: CO: RMW for  SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Liddle. ADA:  Matthew L Hartung   DF ATTY:  John A. Kucinski   DF:  Kristopher Charles Bonikowske appeared. Case called at 3:09 p.m. Short conversation off the record. Continue PTC. Address confirmed. Bond continues. hml  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 6, 2016 at 09:15 am.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Rohan. ADA: Megan Kelly  DF ATTY:  John A. Kucinski   DF:  Kristopher Charles Bonikowske appeared. Matter was set for PTC. Atty. Kucinski requests matter be reset. Address confirmed. Bond continues  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 20, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Notice of Motion to Suppress Statements and Notice of Motion to Suppress Evidence. Filed by Atty Kucinski. km

Bond on file. 

-It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Breanne B.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ordered that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis Stats.

CO: SRN, RPR: Vicki Kasten, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA:  Michael Edward Nieskes,  DF ATTY:  John A. Kucinski,  DF:  Kristopher Charles Bonikowske appeared. Court confirms address.  Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG.  Waives speedy trial.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 18, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
